messages.subject: Re: suggested online games for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: Time to strew the path with some new (preferably free or low cost) online games for my girls (8&4)....do your kids have any favorites you can share with me?
messages.messageBody:
"Time to strew the path with some new (preferably free or low cost)
online games for my girls (8&4)....do your kids have any favorites you
can share with me?"

Sierra (9) really loves meez.com where you can style and create your
own "Meez" character. If your girls are into clothing, they'll love
it. Heck, *I* love it!
She also loves Kiropets where you can create pets, feed them, play
with them etc... She likes it better than neopets. I think we had to
fake her age to get on those though.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: suggested online games for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Aimee, My girls (5 & 7) like these games: DisneyChannel.com http://psc.disney.go.com/disneychannel/games/index.html PBS Kids http://pbskids.org/go/ Nick Jr
messages.messageBody:
Hi Aimee,

My girls (5 & 7) like these games:

DisneyChannel.com
http://psc.disney.go.com/disneychannel/games/index.html

PBS Kids
http://pbskids.org/go/

Nick Jr (mostly my 5 yo)
http://www.nickjr.com/playtime/cats/games/index.jhtml

zone.msn.com (Bejeweled, Chainz2, Chuzzle, GemShop)
http://zone.msn.com/en/root/puzzle.htm
http://zone.msn.com/en/bejeweled2/game.htm
http://zone.msn.com/en/gemshop/game.htm
http://zone.msn.com/en/chuzzle/game.htm?video=1
http://zone.msn.com/en/chainz2/game.htm

Hubby likes the games at WarnerBros:
http://www2.warnerbros.com/web/games/index.jsp

If you find any others, I'd love to update our webpage with them to
strew some new ones too.

Cara :)

messages.subject: Re: suggested online games for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: ... can share ... check out wickedsmallgames.com. There s also one called whizzball on the kids.discovery website - you build a mousetrap type thing with
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Aimee & Paul Bogush"
<shaggyhill@...> wrote:
>
> Hi there,
>
>
>
> Time to strew the path with some new (preferably free or low cost)
>online
> games for my girls (8&4)....do your kids have any favorites you
can >share
> with me?
check out wickedsmallgames.com. There's also one called whizzball on
the kids.discovery website - you build a "mousetrap" type thing with
springs and pushers and conveyors and such to get from the drop tube
to the 'goal' OR you can play a puzzle someone else has built - it
shows the start and the goal and gray areas where pieces go and an
inventory of which pieces to use for this particular puzzle. DH
likes trying to figure out puzzles, DS (8) likes to play with making
his own stuff.

--Deb

messages.subject: suggested online games for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi there, Time to strew the path with some new (preferably free or low cost) online games for my girls (8&4)....do your kids have any favorites you can share
messages.messageBody:
Hi there,



Time to strew the path with some new (preferably free or low cost) online
games for my girls (8&4)....do your kids have any favorites you can share
with me? I have some sites for zoos and pongo games, but so far nothing has
interested them (as much as everythinggirl.com & pollypocket.com). Line
rider is also still interesting to them, but mostly it's become dad's
obsession, lol. Anyway...before I put in the research time, I thought I'd
just ask for favorites first.



Thanks in advance,



Aimee in CT

With Paul, Emma (8) and Annie (4)



Commit random acts of literacy!

Read & Release at <http://www.bookcrossing.com/friend/shaggyhill>
http://www.bookcrossing.com/friend/shaggyhill



It is never too late to be what you might have been. ~~George Eliot



"unschooler, n : one who learns from life and love and great books

and late morning conversations and big projects and eccentric uncles

and mountains and mistakes and volunteering and starry nights..."

~~From a t-shirt found at: <http://www.lowryhousepublishers.com/>
www.lowryhousepublishers.com
